displaytitle: The Source of the Arvaron in the Vallery of Chamouni, Savoy , plate 60 from Liber Studiorum, part XII

titles.title: The Source of the Arvaron in the Vallery of Chamouni, Savoy , plate 60 from Liber Studiorum, part XII

makers.displaydate: 1775–1851; born London, England; died Chelsea, England
makers.displaymaker: Joseph Mallord William Turner, 1775–1851; born London, England; died Chelsea, England

texts.textentryhtml: Published between 1807 and 1819, Turner’s Liber Studiorum (Book of Studies) consisted of seventy prints (plus a frontispiece) that disseminated his ideas about landscape to a broader audience. His sketches of Alpine vistas near the French town of Chamonix made during his 1802 Continental trip served as the basis for this dramatic composition. It has been suggested that he may have entrusted the preliminary etching to the professional printmaker Henry Edward Dawe before applying mezzotint himself to develop tone. Turner included the letter M in the upper margin to indicate his category of “Mountainous landscape.”
texts.remarks: K2 corridor: “The Artful Disposition of Shades”: The Great Age of British Mezzotints
